data.title: Very slow
data.text: We stop by there for lunch and I had a Reuben sandwich and my wife had the Philly cheesesteak. We order at the same time we both had ice water to drink. About 20 minutes later my wife's sandwich came. Five minutes later mine came. When I finish my water I had to go to the counter and ask for more. The food was very good but the service was terrible. I will probably never go there again.

data.title: Classic Small Town Cafe Food and Service
data.text: Allin's Diner is like a classic small town café - and St. Charles is not a small town anymore.  They have good food and it is served the way you request it to be prepared.  The servers are always friendly and helpful.  We typically get breakfast there.  They have a good following.  It is a small place and seating is limited.  We always enjoy our visit to Allin's Diner. Reminds me of the time my grandmother used to have a restaurant in St. Charles in the 1950's and 1960's.

data.title: Delicious food cooked to order & awesome soups made in-house.
data.text:
Allin's Diner is only open for breakfast & lunch. Totally worth the drive to eat Allin's soup alone--there are 3-6 different varieties available everyday. The menu lists 40+ soups that they make on and off all year long. I highly recommend the hamburger potato leek. The chili is fabulous too! 
Allin's also has a great breakfast menu. If you're not in the mood for eggs or soup try a sandwich--they have many types. Put your meat & topping on bred, a wrap or plain lettuce; they aim to please everyone. Sides are varied as well. Something for everyone.

data.title: Something for Everyone
data.text: When everyone wants something different for breakfast this is a great place for Sunday brunch.  We got there about 10:30 lots of parking and just lucky enough to get 2 tables.  Large menu selections.  Pancakes for the kids, omelettes, hearty egg breakfasts for the adults, and  I had their delish slinger.  One of the few chefs that actually knows what and over medium egg is.  Don't know why those short order cooks at the chain restaurants can never get right.  Check out their lunch menu too.

data.title: Classic diner with awesome home-cooked food and recipes!!
data.text: If you can get in, it's a great place to eat!! :)  Not many tables, but really, the size is perfect!  Feels like the old days when you go in there with pictures of customers all over the walls.  Great food and great service from waitresses who have been doing it for YEARS! :)

data.title: Great Breakfast and Lunch
data.text: Went here for lunch today.  Some of us got breakfast items (omelette, hash browns, pancakes), and others lunch items.  Everything was very good.  You can also get soup by the quart to go.  It was full (does not seat many people), but service was quick.  It is also non-smoking.  Will go again.

data.title: Excellent old style diner!
data.text: This is a small old style diner.  Great breakfast foods.  Will need to come back for lunch.  There are only a hanful of tables and 2 servers.  The food is cooked to order in a small kitfchen

data.title: Wonderful food and excellent service!
data.text: I try to order something different each time but I keep going back to turkey on cranberry bread?  It is so yummy.  Great seasoned chips with this lunch.  Also spicy burrito is yummy.  Coke products and great soups and breakfast plates.  I bring people from work here all the time.  Too far away for my family to come.  They are only open until 3 p.m. most days.... I think.  So much better than fast food.

data.title: No greasy spoon here! Excellent and fresh!
data.text: You know your in the right place to eat when the owner is usually present and is either cooking or seating customers getting their  coffee when it's busy with his leather jacket and motorcycle boots on! Love the fresh food here, no deep fryer here. The French toast is made from a French baguette! Homemade soup and sandwiches is my fav for lunch. Not a burger dive, real food.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Wonderful diner-style breakfast.  We planned our stop for a late breakfast while running errands around St. Charles.  I can recommend the eggs Nuevo, but everything on my husband's plate was great.  We noticed the soup list for the day.... Very extensive choices.  Looks very inviting.

data.title: Home cooked breakfast
data.text: Centrally located in old town St Charles on Kingshighway, just down the street from Lindenwood University entrance.  Small place, so timing is key, in order to get a table.  Not a place to have a private conversation as the tables are close together.  Service was quick, and the waitresses were frequently around with coffee refills.  Food tasted home made and not like from a big chain.  Would definitely eat here again.  On a side note, it's not inexpensive.

data.title: Just Like a Greasy Spoon But Better
data.text: If you follow my reviews you will know that I use "greasy spoon" as a high compliment. I  wish there were more. Allin's is right around the corner from my office and I get there as often as I can. Usually it is for breakfast. It attracts a lot of regulars. The servers are always friendly and helpful. It is good old comfort food. There is nothing fancy about the place but it is clean and cheerful. The food is good and the prices are just what they should be.

data.title: Classic Diner
data.text: We came here for breakfast on a Saturday morning.   The place is small so there was a wait but not too long.  Our party of six split up because we couldn't wait for two tables next to each other to open up.  We waited a long time for our food, which a customer who goes there frequently said is not usually the case.   It turned out their main cook had sliced his finger open so a newer, less experienced, less fast-moving cook was on the job.  Our food came out in segments. I got my pancakes, then ten minutes later I got my oatmeal.   My husband got his meal five minutes after that.  The food was good.  I would return and give them another chance to be faster.  Prices are reasonable.

data.title: Great old style diner
data.text: Diners.  I love them.  This has both the old style feel and good food.  Waitress was very attentive.  Ordered a 6-egg (standard size for this diner) house special omelet - sausage & sharp cheddar cheese.  Delicious!  My eatery mate said the pancakes were fantastic. I took a bite and he was right.  I would have ordered one by couldn't afford the carbs (and I do love a good pancake!).  Small place, but only add to diner feel.

data.title: Awesome breakfast!
data.text:
This is one of my favorite breakfast places in St Charles County! It is old school! Small and homey!
 My wife and I LOVE the breakfast quesadilla!!!! It is huge! The salsa really makes it pop! The french toast is wonderful also!

data.title: Fairly standard
data.text: Looking for a unique brunch, we ended up at Allin's Diner. I was a bit disappointed. Everything was good, but I felt it was standard diner fare that you can get anywhere. I could tell it was definitely a hot spot for the locals, but we expected a little bit more.

data.title: Just like granny's backyard
data.text: Recently while on a trip to old Saint Charles my husband my daughter and I decided to try breakfast at Alans. We chose to sit out on the patio. Very old but cute. Our waitress assured us after we told her it was our first time that we would really enjoy it. She said the breakfast food is really good. We were not disappointed we enjoyed our visit there as well as the food. That's not like you were with family having breakfast in granny's backyard. Will definitely go again if in the area would recommend.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: This is my family's favorite local diner. It's tiny, but we have always managed to secure a table (although sometimes we've gotten the last one available!). It is a bit pricier than most diner fare, but we willingly pay the little extra. The food is outstanding - the best diner pancakes I've ever had. Service is generally pretty good, but sometimes during busy times the wait staff gets overwhelmed and can be short or less attentive. Normally they are good, however, and the food is cooked and at the table in minutes. Highly recommended!

data.title: No lunch forme!
data.text: My husband and I went in about 1:15 pm for a cheeseburger and chili dog. His chili dog arrived about 1:40.  We asked the unconcerned waitress twice about the burger several other tables received incorrect and/or partial orders   Maybe a new cook?  Maybe just a very bad cook. At 2:02 we put $10 on the table and left. Extremely poor service and lack of concern   Will NOT be going back.

data.title: Diner delight!
data.text: Fast, friendly, cute diner with good food.  Had the full house special omelet which was a 6 egg omelet with andouille and sharp cheddar.  From ordering to being served food approximately 5 minutes to a hot, fresh, fluffy omelet!  They did NOT skimp on the meat or cheese which was great!  I also love that they have real cheese not just american.   Friendly and attentive waitress.  I visited at 7 am on a Sunday so not super busy at the time, in a strip mall with lots of parking.  It is a small ish place so may get hopping and have some waiting not sure.  Loved it will be back for sure !
